intro: Anneslia palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's anneslia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Anneslia palmeri is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
